Title: Palatini action
Explanation: The metric and connection are independent. Variation not on the connection. Note the new Ricci tensor is constructed with an independent connection:  $\Re=g_{\mu\nu}R_{\mu\nu}$.

Title: Total action
Explanation: Total action for a metric $f(R)$.

Title: $R=Const<0$
Explanation: Ricci scalar is constant and negative at all points.

Title: $R=Const>0$
Explanation: Ricci scalar is constant and positive at all points.

Title: $f(R)=R$
Explanation: The function dependent on the Ricci scalar is of first order.

Title: $f(R)\neqR$
Explanation: The function dependent on the Ricci scalar is of high order.

Title: $f(\Re)=\Re$
Explanation: The function of the affine curvature scalar is of first order

Title: $f(\Re)\neq\Re$
Explanation: The function of the affine curvature scalar is of high order

Title: $f’(R)=1$
Explanation: The first derivative of the function dependent on the Ricci scalar is one.

Title: $f’’(R) =0$
Explanation: The second derivative of the function of the Ricci scalar is zero.

Title: $f’’(R)≠-0$
Explanation: The second derivative of the function of the Ricci scalar is not zero.

Title: $f''(\Re)=0$
Explanation: The second derivative of the function of the affine curvature scalar is zero.

Title: $f''(\Re)\neq0$
Explanation: The second derivative of the function of the affine curvature scalar is not zero.

Title: Non metricity tensor vanishes
Explanation: Homogeneous Trautman condition.

Title: $R=0$
Explanation: The Ricci scalar is zero.

Title: $R=Const.$
Explanation: The Ricci scalar is constant.

Title: $T_{\mu\nu}\rightarrow0$: Dust
Explanation: Energy momentum tensor is almost zero; models for dust.

Title: Cartan torsion tensor vanishes
Explanation: Homogeneous Trautman Condition $\widetilde{R}_{bd}^{ac}=\widetilde{R}_{db}^{ca}$.

Title: Einstein’s field equation
Explanation: Matter tells space how tu curve, and Curvature tells matter how to move.

Title: Palatini field equation 2
Explanation: ($\bar{\nabla}_{\lambda}$) is the covariant derivative defined with the independent connection.

Title: Field Equation
Explanation: Field equation after varying independently with respect to the connection.

Title: Field Equation
Explanation: Field equation after varying independently with respect to the Lagrange multiplier.
If the Ricci scalar $R=0$, then the field equation reduces to $R_{\mu\eta}=0$.

If the Ricci scalar $R=const.$, then the field equation reduces to $R_{\mu\nu}=g_{\mu\nu}\frac{C}{4}$, and the maximally symmetric solution is de Sitter or anti-de Sitter space depending on the sign of the constant.

If the Ricci scalar $R=cte$, then the field equation reduces to $R_{\mu\nu}=g_{\mu\nu}\frac{C}{4}$, and the maximally symmetric solution is de Sitter or anti-de Sitter space depending on the sign of the constant.

Title: $\Gamma$: Affine connection
Explanation: A generalised connection for vector fields in curved spaces where torsion and non-metricity are not necessarily zero, telling us about straitest curve.

Title: Hypermomentum
Explanation: A quantity representing the variation of SM with respect to the connection, which mimics the definition of the stress-energy tensor.

Title: $\Gamma*$: Metric-Affine connection
Explanation: A connection for Metric-affine spaces where non-metricity and torsion are not zero.

Title: $\left\{ _{\mu\nu}^{\lambda}\right\} $: Metric connection
Explanation: Also called Levi-Civita connection, it is dependent on the metric $g$. It gives us information about how to transport vectors along a curve, while conserving the metric.

Title: $g_{\mu\nu}$: Metric tensor
Explanation: A symmetric tensor field of type $(0,2)$ and signature $<1,3>$. Provides a sense of distance and angles between vectors telling us about shortest curve.

Title: Non metricity tensor
Explanation: It measures the failure of the connection to covariantly conserve the metric.

Title: $T$: Stress-Energy-Momentum tensor field
Explanation: Symmetric tensor field $(2,0)$.

Title: Cartan torsion tensor
Explanation: The anti-symmetric part of the connection.

Title: Weyl vector
Explanation: The Weyl vector is the trace of the non-metricity tensor with respect to its last two (symmetric) indices.

Title: M: Differentiable manifold
Explanation: A topological space that resembles euclidean space near each point. It can be coordinatized by Rn through a family of homeomorphisms.

Title: Geodesic Law
Explanation: Free particles follow timeline geodesics of the connection.

Title: Dependency
Explanation: The connection $\Gamma_{\mu\nu}^{\lambda}$  and the metric tensor $g_{\mu\nu}$  depend on each other.

Title: Independency between variables
Explanation: The connection $\Gamma_{\mu\nu}^{\lambda}$ may be expressed independently of the metric tensor $g_{\mu\nu}$.

Title: Dimension: $N=4$
Explanation: The dimension of a vector space is the cardinality of a base of $M$.

Title: Signature
Explanation: for the metric tensor: Not-definite-positive $<-,+,+,+>$ or $<+,-,-,->$.
